alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 18 at 11:15AM CDT until March 22 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 AM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in Cahaba Valley Creek due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Cahaba Valley Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Harpersville, Westover, Oak Mountain State Park, Highland Lakes, Meadowbrook, Fowler Lake, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, Inverness and Mount Laurel.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
